content:
• Wednesday, December 21, 2011
  • CCSC

    Country Style Cooking (NYSE:CCSC) is down 9.7% AH, making a new 52-week low in the process,...

    Country Style Cooking (NYSE:CCSC) is down 9.7% AH, making a new 52-week low in the process, after announcing its CFO will resign due to "personal reasons," effective Jan. 31. Shares of the Chinese fast-food chain fell last month after it posted Q3 results.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM | 1 Comment
  • TIBX

    Tibco (NASDAQ:TIBX) guides on its earnings call for FQ1 revenue of $220M-$225M ($215.8M...

    Tibco (NASDAQ:TIBX) guides on its earnings call for FQ1 revenue of $220M-$225M ($215.8M consensus) and EPS of $0.18-$0.19 ($0.18 consensus). Tibco's shares, which were down as much as 5% following its FQ4 report, are now up 1.4% AH. (webcast)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM
  • FINL

    Finish Line (NASDAQ:FINL) drops 2.2% AH after reporting FQ3 revenue of $282M (+8% Y/Y) and EPS...

    Finish Line (NASDAQ:FINL) drops 2.2% AH after reporting FQ3 revenue of $282M (+8% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.11; the former beat by $9.3M, but the latter was just in-line. Same-store sales rose 7.7% Y/Y, and the company's gross margin came in at 32.2% (down from FQ2's 35.1%). Finish Line is also reporting its same-store sales rose 7% Y/Y for the first 3 weeks of the holiday season.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • WCAA

    Texas-based waste removal firm WCA Waste (NASDAQ:WCAA) agrees to be acquired by Macquarie...

    Texas-based waste removal firm WCA Waste (NASDAQ:WCAA) agrees to be acquired by Macquarie Infrastructure Partners II for $526M, equating to around $6.50 a share, which is a 32% premium to today's closing price. Shares +29.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • MLHR

    Herman Miller (NASDAQ:MLHR) posts a mixed FQ2 with its EPS meeting estimates but missing on...

    Herman Miller (NASDAQ:MLHR) posts a mixed FQ2 with its EPS meeting estimates but missing on revenue, despite an extra week of sales during the quarter. New orders declined 4% Y/Y to $440M. Shares -2.3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • PLCM

    Polycom (PLCM +2%) finishes the day higher after Citigroup ups the shares to Buy on valuation,...

    Polycom (PLCM +2%) finishes the day higher after Citigroup ups the shares to Buy on valuation, saying the stock has been hit by overly negative sentiment which has crushed the shares nearly 50% since early July, and presents a buying opportunity.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • GE

    General Electric (GE +2.3%) has easily outperformed its peers since announcing a dividend raise...

    General Electric (GE +2.3%) has easily outperformed its peers since announcing a dividend raise Dec. 9, and shares are posting another strong gain. Since Dec. 9, GE shares have climbed 5.9%, vs. a 1.5% drop for United Technologies (NYSE:UTX) and a 3.3% fall for Siemens (SI). Against financial stocks, GE is also clearly ahead.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO +3.6%) soars as the NYT reports it is considering a deal to sell its holdings of...

    Yahoo (YHOO +3.6%) soars as the NYT reports it is considering a deal to sell its holdings of Alibaba and its Japanese affiliate back to their owners - a tricky tax-free deal valued at $17B (Yahoo's total market cap is about $20B). Yahoo's board is expected to meet Thursday to discuss the proposal. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 2 Comments
  • WWAY

    Westway Group (WWAY +29.5%) says it received an unsolicited offer from an infrastructure...

    Westway Group (WWAY +29.5%) says it received an unsolicited offer from an infrastructure investment fund to acquire the company for $6/share early this week and rejected it as too low. The provider of bulk liquid storage services received an unsolicited preliminary offer from ED&F Man, its largest shareholder, earlier this month.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM
  • LUK-OLD

    Jefferies (JEF -4.7%) gives back a chunk of yesterday's big gain after Meredith Whitney...

    Jefferies (JEF -4.7%) gives back a chunk of yesterday's big gain after Meredith Whitney downgrades the stock and Keefe Bruyette warns of remaining problems, after JEF seemingly soothed investor concerns about its exposure to European debt. KBW largely attributes yesterday's surge to short-covering, while cutting its 2012 EPS view 20% on a lower revenue forecast.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM
  • PAYX

    Paychex (PAYX -3.5%) shares slide after FQ2 profit beat expectations helped by revenue growth in...

    Paychex (PAYX -3.5%) shares slide after FQ2 profit beat expectations helped by revenue growth in its payroll processing business, but it offers a cautious outlook. Growth in its "checks per client," the number of paychecks clients issued divided by its average customer base, slowed to 1.5% from 2% Q/Q, and PAYX sees continued "moderation" in the measure.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • CFFN

    Bank holding company Capitol Federal (CFFN +2%) catches a bid after disclosing its board has...

    Bank holding company Capitol Federal (CFFN +2%) catches a bid after disclosing its board has approved a $193M stock buyback plan. The plan good for purchasing roughly 10% of the company's outstanding shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM
  • ZLTQ

    Zeltiq Aesthetics (ZLTQ -5.9%) falls back down after getting a lot of attention from analysts...

    Zeltiq Aesthetics (ZLTQ -5.9%) falls back down after getting a lot of attention from analysts earlier this week when Goldman Sachs initiated coverage with a Buy rating and lofty $19 price target and William Blair set an Outperform rating. Trader chatter ties today's dropoff to profit-taking.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • VECO

    Veeco Instruments (VECO -5.7%) trades lower, despite being initiated with a Hold on valuation at...

    Veeco Instruments (VECO -5.7%) trades lower, despite being initiated with a Hold on valuation at Needham. The shares have been pummelled since early June, down nearly 64% and setting a new 52-week low on today's action.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • DCTH

    Delcath Systems (OTC:DCTH +17.6%) pops after announcing it's appointed highly respected...

    Delcath Systems (OTC:DCTH +17.6%) pops after announcing it's appointed highly respected hepatologist and 2011 President of the International Liver Cancer Association, Dr. Gregory Gores, to its Medical Advisory Board. The company expects his insight will provide valuable support to the commercialization of its Delcath Hepatic Chemosat Delivery System in Europe.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • SVU

    Analysts start to warm up to grocery stocks with CNBC Fast Money's Steve Cortes highlighting...

    Analysts start to warm up to grocery stocks with CNBC Fast Money's Steve Cortes highlighting that he is bullish on Supervalu (SVU +3.4%) as agricultural commodities near lows and Deutsche Bank issuing positive comments on Kroger (KR +2.4%) and Safeway (SWY +1.4%)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM
  • WBA

    Walgreen (WAG -1.9%) CEO Gregory Wasson says his company tried last week to resolve the dispute...

    Walgreen (WAG -1.9%) CEO Gregory Wasson says his company tried last week to resolve the dispute with pharmacy benefits manager Express Scripts (ESRX -0.3%) but received a response that was “not very meaningful." But the FQ1 earnings report says the drugstore chain expects to retain 97%-99% of its 2011 prescription volume in fiscal 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM
  • LNN

    Lindsay (LNN -6.8%) takes a hit after its FQ1 earnings fell 32% due to higher...

    Lindsay (LNN -6.8%) takes a hit after its FQ1 earnings fell 32% due to higher environmental-remediation expenses. Irrigation-equipment sales, its biggest top line contributor, surged 68%, but reduced revenue from its infrastructure segment mitigated much of those gains, slumping 37% Y/Y on lower sales and leases of its moveable barrier systems.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • ZAGG

    Zagg (ZAGG -6.7%), which fell yesterday thanks to bearish comments from Jim Cramer, is selling...

    Zagg (ZAGG -6.7%), which fell yesterday thanks to bearish comments from Jim Cramer, is selling off again today in spite of a revenue guidance hike; Zagg now expects its 2011 revenue to exceed $175M, above both prior guidance of $170M, and a $171.8M consensus. A 2.2M share lock-up expiration related to Zagg's $105M purchase of iFrogz may be having an effect.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM
  • EMR

    On a feisty conference call regarding its warning over orders, Emerson (EMR -5.3%) CEO David...

    On a feisty conference call regarding its warning over orders, Emerson (EMR -5.3%) CEO David Farr says the company is seeing more global economic weakness since early November. He believes Europe could be in recession for most of 2012.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • TDC

    Teradata (TDC -9.6%) shares tumble in the wake of Oracle's weak report (also) plus Oppenheimer's...

    Teradata (TDC -9.6%) shares tumble in the wake of Oracle's weak report (also) plus Oppenheimer's reduced rating on the stock. TDC faces "an increasingly challenging selling environment,” as large exposure to international and financial sectors combined with ongoing gross margin pressure and difficult earnings comps in 2012 warrant investor caution.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • EXPE

    Expedia (EXPE +3.3%) is moving higher, and TripAdvisor (TRIP -5.5%) is selling off, on the...

    Expedia (EXPE +3.3%) is moving higher, and TripAdvisor (TRIP -5.5%) is selling off, on the companies' first day of trading as separate entities. Macquarie's Tom White is concerned about the fact Expedia currently accounts for 35% of TripAdvisor's revenue, and suggests a drop in Expedia's ad buying could create a revenue "headwind" of 2%-5%. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • LUK-OLD

    Moody's reaffirms its rating for Jefferies (NYSE:JEF) at Baa2 with a stable outlook, citing the...

    Moody's reaffirms its rating for Jefferies (NYSE:JEF) at Baa2 with a stable outlook, citing the investment bank's relatively low financial leveraging and "straightforward business model." Still, shares are -6.4% after surging 23% yesterday following the company's earnings report.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • TST

    TheStreet.com (TST -2.5%) loses its top exec and takes on an assault from investor FiveMore Fund...

    TheStreet.com (TST -2.5%) loses its top exec and takes on an assault from investor FiveMore Fund all on the same day. The firm says CEO Daryl Otte will step down in the spring, while it searches for a replacement. For its part, FiveMore has its eye on a board seat as it advocates that the company use M&A and strategic alliances to help complement organic growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • SHFL

    Shuffle Master (SHFL +6.6%) trades higher coming off of a positive FQ4 report. The firm's...

    Shuffle Master (SHFL +6.6%) trades higher coming off of a positive FQ4 report. The firm's prospects have brightened as more cash-strapped states have legalized live gambling tables, while the 20% Y/Y in jump in electronic gaming revenue it saw could be just a start if the push to legalize online gambling is successful.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • ORCL

    Unsurprisingly, many enterprise IT names are getting clobbered thanks to Oracle's (ORCL -14.5%)...

    Unsurprisingly, many enterprise IT names are getting clobbered thanks to Oracle's (ORCL -14.5%) FQ2 miss. Tibco (TIBX -13.5%), due to report after the close, is among the hardest hit, though other high-P/E software names are also off strongly. INFA -11.1%. CVLT -15.8%. CTXS -7.3%. CRM -7.2%. The pain also extends to rivals SAP (SAP -6.3%) and IBM (IBM -3.7%), and networking firms F5 (FFIV -7%) and Riverbed (RVBD -5.6%). (more on ORCL)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • AMPE

    Ampio Pharmaceuticals (AMPE -20.1%) announces that it will sell ~2.20M shares of its common...

    Ampio Pharmaceuticals (AMPE -20.1%) announces that it will sell ~2.20M shares of its common stock at a price of $4.25 in a direct offering (SEC filing) to accredited investors. It's not a December to remember for the firm with shares now off 47% over the last 7 trading sessions.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • EXEL

    Exelixis (EXEL +3.6%) says it's licensed its PI3K-delta research and development program to...

    Exelixis (EXEL +3.6%) says it's licensed its PI3K-delta research and development program to Merck (MRK +0.2%) for $12M plus an additional $239M in combined milestone and royalty payments. The sale will allow the company to focus its energies on developing its lead compound cabozantinib, a potential treatment for cancer.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • KBH

    KB Home (KBH -5.2%) shares reverse early gains, as attention shifts toward from Q4 results...

    KB Home (KBH -5.2%) shares reverse early gains, as attention shifts toward from Q4 results showing a 20% drop in earnings and away from higher new home deliveries and a higher average selling price. Ticonderoga notes strong orders of the last two quarters aren't showing sufficient margins, which would prevent useful profitability in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • SHAW

    Shaw Group (SHAW +13.6%) goes on a run after knocking out an impressive FQ1 earnings beat and...

    Shaw Group (SHAW +13.6%) goes on a run after knocking out an impressive FQ1 earnings beat and lifting its view for FY12. The firm says adjusted EPS will fall in a range of $2.05-$2.15, up from prior guidance of $2.00-$2.10.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM +7.5%) is still up strongly on account of newfound M&A hopes (I,...

    Research In Motion (RIMM +7.5%) is still up strongly on account of newfound M&A hopes (I, II), though it's worth noting shares are still down 12% from the level they were are at going into last week's FQ3 disaster (I, II). ThinkEquity is upgrading RIM to Buy in response, arguing its assets could lead to a buyout price in the mid-20s. However, National Bank thinks RIM's litany of problems makes a deal unlikely.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • BTX

    BioTime (BTX +4.8%) trades up after signing an agreement with USCN Life Science of Wuhan, China,...

    BioTime (BTX +4.8%) trades up after signing an agreement with USCN Life Science of Wuhan, China, to license its antibody-producing cell lines and related technology for use in the large-scale manufacture of antibody components for its cancer detection device, PanC-Dx.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • ATU

    Shares of Actuant (ATU +6.6%) shoot higher after the firm records a FQ1 earnings beat and lifts...

    Shares of Actuant (ATU +6.6%) shoot higher after the firm records a FQ1 earnings beat and lifts its earnings guidance. The firm now see sales hitting $1.6B-$1.65B and EPS falling in a range of $1.85-$2.05 in FY12.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM

  • The slide in shares (I, II,) since the initial euphoria of the ECB's pre-Christmas generosity...

    The slide in shares (I, II,) since the initial euphoria of the ECB's pre-Christmas generosity could be because EU banks will use the cash to pay loans that are due in 2012 rather than to buy sovereign debt. And even if banks want to underwrite government bonds, they will apparently not be able to because of EBA criteria.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM
  • ORCL

    Canaccord isn't appeased by Oracle's (ORCL -12.8%) explanations for its FQ2 shortfall; the firm...

    Canaccord isn't appeased by Oracle's (ORCL -12.8%) explanations for its FQ2 shortfall; the firm is downgrading shares to Hold, arguing the company "needs to rebuild confidence" that it's not heading towards a Microsoft-level valuation over the next few years. However, Jefferies is staying bullish, noting Oracle's FQ3 EPS guidance of $0.55-$0.58 is in-line with a prior forecast of $0.57. (more) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • FSII

    FSI International (NASDAQ:FSII) +8.3% premarket after missing FQ1 revenue and EPS...

    FSI International (NASDAQ:FSII) +8.3% premarket after missing FQ1 revenue and EPS expectations but offering upward guidance for FQ2. FSI sees FQ2 revenue of $30M-$35M, vs. consensus $25.7M, with EPS of $0.05-$0.08, vs. consensus $0.03.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM

  • Market preview: EU and U.S. markets are on a bit of rollercoaster, surging following news that...

    Market preview: EU and U.S. markets are on a bit of rollercoaster, surging following news that Mario Claus is providing 523 EU banks with €489B ($641B) in almost-free loans, then in the red as the operation may not be the hoped-for bazooka. S&P now flat. RIM +10.7% on its flirtations with Amazon, Nokia and Microsoft. Oracle -10.9% after its rare earnings miss. Later: existing home sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • EMR

    "Most important press release today department," tweets Jeff Matthews, "Emerson (NYSE:EMR)...

    "Most important press release today department," tweets Jeff Matthews, "Emerson (NYSE:EMR) reports 'trailing 3 month order trends ... flattened." It's not just about flooding in Thailand, as the company notes slowing in network power orders across all economic regions "will put heavy pressure on Q1 results." Shares -2.5% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM
  • ORCL

    Price targets for Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) are being slashed (I, II) following its FQ2 bombshell (I,...

    Price targets for Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) are being slashed (I, II) following its FQ2 bombshell (I, II, III), which is bound to raise fears of an IT spending slowdown. During its earnings call, Oracle partly blamed the weakness on "an increase in last-minute ... approvals" for large deals, as well as a chip transition for its server business. One silver lining: Oracle hinted Apple has become a major buyer of its costly Exadata systems. ORCL -10.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM | 1 Comment
  • EXPE

    Expedia (NASDAQ:EXPE) -53% after effecting a one-for-two reverse stock split and officially...

    Expedia (NASDAQ:EXPE) -53% after effecting a one-for-two reverse stock split and officially spinning off TripAdvisor, which has been trading under the ticker symbol TRIPV since Dec. 6 but will now trade under TRIP. TripAdvisor is also part of the S&P 500. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:52 AM
  • AMZN

    Whole Foods Market (WFM) -1.2% premarket after filing a registration statement announcing...

    Whole Foods Market (WFM) -1.2% premarket after filing a registration statement announcing affiliates of PE firm Leonard Green will offer 13.9M WFM shares to the public. The company itself is not issuing new shares and will not benefit directly from the sale.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM
  • KMX

    More on Carmax (NYSE:KMX) FQ3: Net income flat at $82.8M; same-store used-unit sales -3% vs....

    More on Carmax (NYSE:KMX) FQ3: Net income flat at $82.8M; same-store used-unit sales -3% vs. +16% a year earlier; used-car unit sales -1%; new-car sales -13%. Carmax suffering from weak economy and low consumer confidence but anyway plans to to open 10-15 stores/year through FY 2016. Shares +3.15% despite the miss. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:40 AM
  • CTAS

    Shares of Cintas (NASDAQ:CTAS) move up 4.4% premarket after the firm delivers a FQ2 earnings...

    Shares of Cintas (NASDAQ:CTAS) move up 4.4% premarket after the firm delivers a FQ2 earnings beat, led by a big jump in its operating margin to 13.02%. The company updated its 2012 guidance, saying it now sees EPS falling in a range of $2.16-$2.20 - up from its prior estimate of $1.97-$2.05.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 AM
  • UNM

    Shares of Unum Group (NYSE:UNM) soar 17.1% premarket after Fitch affirms the insurance firm's...

    Shares of Unum Group (NYSE:UNM) soar 17.1% premarket after Fitch affirms the insurance firm's senior debt rating at BBB with a stable outlook. The ratings agency says Unum's investment portfolio is "well-positioned" to weather the credit market after it reduced its credit exposure and improved its interest rate risk management.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:58 AM
  • TEVA

    Teva Pharmaceuticals (NYSE:TEVA) announces a $3B share repurchase program, expected to be...

    Teva Pharmaceuticals (NYSE:TEVA) announces a $3B share repurchase program, expected to be completed over a 3-year period. The size of the buyback represents 8% of all outstanding TEVA common stock. Shares +2.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:36 AM
  • CPTS

    Conceptus (NASDAQ:CPTS) announces that it's entered into separate private exchanges of notes...

    Conceptus (NASDAQ:CPTS) announces that it's entered into separate private exchanges of notes under which $50M of senior notes get swapped for a different series of convertible senior notes due 2031. Shares -4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:32 AM
  • BB

    Shares of Research In Motion (RIMM) trade 10.7% higher in premarket action after reports (I, II)...

    Shares of Research In Motion (RIMM) trade 10.7% higher in premarket action after reports (I, II) crop up that big players such as Microsoft, Nokia, and Amazon were flirting with buying the embattled company over the last several months.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:18 AM | 5 Comments
  • DB

    Following the ECB's loan numbers, European banks are climbing premarket: DB +4%, ING +3.2%, STD...

    Following the ECB's loan numbers, European banks are climbing premarket: DB +4%, ING +3.2%, STD +1.3%, LYG +6.25%, BCS +4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:59 AM
  • UNCFF

    UniCredit (OTCPK:UNCFF) and Intesa Sanpaolo (OTCPK:ISNPY) are among the Italian banks that will...

    UniCredit (OTCPK:UNCFF) and Intesa Sanpaolo (OTCPK:ISNPY) are among the Italian banks that will reportedly use bonds guaranteed by Italy as collateral for loans from the ECB. Sources say officials from Italy's biggest banks are meeting with the Finance Ministry today to define the terms of the transaction. In Italy, UniCredit +2%, Intesa +2.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 AM | 1 Comment

  • Taiwan's benchmark index posts its biggest gain in more than two years, climbing 4.6%, after the...

    Taiwan's benchmark index posts its biggest gain in more than two years, climbing 4.6%, after the government said it will let its National Stabilization Fund buy equities to support domestic markets.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 AM | 1 Comment
